III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention Standards and Prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth’s
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff at the facility have banged youth's head on the wall and
choked him while attempting to restrain him. It is unknown if there
have been marks or bruises from these incidents. It is unknown
when this last occurred or if there have ever been marks or
bruises from these incidents.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Complainant was interviewed via phone on 9/8/23.
Complainant reported Youth A did not name a specific staff
member, specific dates, or any injuries he received as a result of
staff allegedly choking him and banging his head on the wall while
attempting to restrain him.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the hospital on
8/11/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported
he went AWOL on 8/1/23. On 8/10/23 he was brought to the
hospital. Youth A reported he told his foster care worker and the
hospital staff he didn’t want to go back to the facility because he
didn’t feel safe there with the staff and the other youth. Youth A
reported after he was discharged from the hospital on 8/10/23, he
was brought back to the facility. After returning to the facility, he
reported he was feeling anxious, so he grabbed a metal pipe and
began breaking stuff. Youth A reported Supervisor lied and told
law enforcement officers he hit Supervisor with a metal pole, but
he didn’t. Youth A reported a staff (didn’t know who) took the
2

metal pipe from him and then Staff 5 restrained him. Youth A
reported Supervisor, Staff 2, Staff 5, Staff 7 and Staff 11 all had a
part in restraining him. Youth A reported during the restraint, he
was sitting on the floor with Staff 5 holding him and Staff 2 and
Staff 7 were holding his arms behind him. Youth A reported he
told all the staff they were hurting him during the restraint and
yelled for them to stop, but they wouldn’t stop. Youth A reported
he punched Staff 11 when Staff 11 attempted to help restrain him.
Youth A reported while in the restraint, he bit Staff 5 on the leg
and Staff 5 said “I don’t care if you’re a kid, I’m going to do
something to you”. Youth A reported he was let out of the restraint
when other youth on the unit started coming out of their rooms
and into the milieu area. Youth A reported Youth B and Youth F
started beating him up by punching him in the face and stomping
on him while he was on the floor. Youth A reported Staff 11 tried
to stop Youth B and Youth F by standing in front of them, but
when he couldn’t stop them, Supervisor, Staff 2, Staff 5, Staff 7
and Staff 11 stood there and watched it happen. Youth A reported
Youth E was also present, but he did not participate in the
altercation. Youth A reported Staff 7 restrained him on an
unknown date, choked Youth A and banged his head against the
wall. Youth A reported Staff 6, Supervisor, Youth B, Youth C and
Youth D were all present. Youth A reported he asked Staff 7 to
stop and stated he couldn’t breathe, but Staff 7 said “no, someone
has to teach you a lesson”. During another restraint on an
unknown date, Youth A reported Staff 10 sat on Youth A’s back
while Youth A was face down to the ground. Youth A reported
Staff 9 was present for the restraint, and it happened in the north
hallway of the facility. Youth A reported Staff 1, Staff 5, Staff 7,
and Supervisor have all made threats against him and tell him
they’ll hit him, and they don’t care if they lose their jobs. Youth A
reported Staff 7 has also said “I’ll lose my job because of you. I’ll
kill you. I don’t care”. Youth A reported Staff 1 told Youth A “you’re
just a rich little white boy and I hope your grandma dies”. Youth A
reported Staff 11 has said “you’re acting like a little kid and I’m
going to show you what a grown man is” and screamed “I’ll kick
your ass. I don’t care”. Youth A reported approximately a month
ago he told Foster Care Worker about concerns with staff member
injuring him and leaving bruises on him, so she took pictures of
the bruises he had. she took pictures. Youth A reported Foster
Care Worker didn’t say anything else to him except “stick to
yourself” and “I’ll get you out of here”. Youth A reported
Supervisor showed Foster Care Worker the restraints they do at
the facility, and they all had a conversation that the bruises he
received were normal due to the restraint positioning and Youth A
resisting the restraints.
3

Youth A’s Foster Care Worker (FCW) was interviewed via
phone on 8/11/23. FCW reported Youth A does not want to be at
the facility, so he is doing everything possible to leave. FCW
reported Youth A previously destroyed the heating/cooling unit,
threw chairs, assaulted staff, and broke staff’s belongings. FCW
reported staff at the facility were quitting or wanted to quit because
of Youth A’s behaviors. FCW stated she visited Youth A at the
facility on 7/21/23 and he reported to her he had received bruises
because of staff restraining him. FCW reported she talked to
Supervisor about the complaint and Supervisor informed FCW
Youth A flails, kicks and moves around a lot during the restraints,
which can cause bruises where staff are holding him. Supervisor
demonstrated the different restraint holds to FCW and FCW was
able to confirm Youth A’s bruises were all explained by the
restraint hold positioning and Youth A fighting to get out of the
restraint. FCW reported she has no concerns with the restraints
being completed or Youth A’s injuries. FCW reported she told
Youth A he needs to stop moving around during restraints, so he
stops getting injuries. Youth A insisted FCW take pictures of his
bruises, so she did.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on 8/11/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth B reported Youth A
returned from AWOL on 8/10/23. Youth B reported he was in his
room when he heard commotion in the milieu, so he left his room
to see what was going on. He reported he saw Staff 5, Staff 7 and
Staff 11 restraining Youth A. Youth B reported Youth A was sitting
on the floor while Staff 5 was holding Youth A’s legs, Staff 11 was
holding Youth A’s body and Staff 7 was holding Youth A’s arms.
Youth B reported Youth A was yelling racial slurs at the staff while
he was in the restraint, but he didn’t hear the staff say anything
back. Youth B reported he saw Supervisor look at him, so he went
back to his room because he wasn’t supposed to be out of his
room since it was bedtime. Youth B reported shortly after, he
heard someone screaming so he went back out to the milieu to
see what was going on. When he got to the milieu, he saw Youth
A getting beat up by another youth (refused to name who), so
Youth B joined in and started beating up Youth A too. Youth B
reported staff members (couldn’t remember who) jumped in and
separated Youth B from Youth A. Youth B reported he has seen
Youth A get restrained two other times. One time, Staff 7 and
Supervisor were involved in one of the restraints, but he can’t
remember which staff were involved in the other one. Youth B
reported he has never seen staff do anything violent to Youth A
(hit, kick, bang his head, choke, sit on him, pinned him against a
4

chair, smash him against the wall or floor, threaten him, etc.).
Youth B reported he has never heard Youth A complain about
injuries from a restraint.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on 8/11/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth C reported he has
seen Youth A be restrained five times. Youth C reported the staff
involved in the various restraints were Supervisor, Staff 3, Staff 5,
Staff 7 and Staff 11. Youth C reported when Youth A is restrained,
he flails his arms, kicks staff, hits staff and threatens staff. Youth C
reported since Youth A fights so much during the restraints, he’s
obviously going to get hurt. Youth C reported he has never seen
staff do anything violent to Youth A (hit, kick, bang his head,
choke, smash him against the wall or floor, threaten him, etc.).
Youth C reported he has never heard Youth A complain about
injuries from a restraint. Youth C reported last night he saw Youth
A punch Staff 11 in the face and when Staff 11 was walking away
he told Youth A “if you don’t stop, you’re going to end up in some
place worse than this”. However, due to Youth A’s behaviors,
Youth C believes it was true and wasn’t meant as a threat.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on 8/11/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth D reported he has
seen Youth A be restrained approximately three times. Youth D
reported Staff 5, Staff 7 and Staff 11 were three of the staff
involved in those restraints, but he could not remember who else
was involved. Youth D reported he has never seen staff do
anything violent to Youth A (hit, kick, bang his head, choke, smash
him against the wall or floor, threaten him, etc.). Youth D reported
Youth A makes threats towards staff about breaking things but
hasn’t heard Youth A threaten any staff members with physical
harm. Youth D reported Youth A has complained about injuries
from a restraint afterwards. Youth D reported Youth A flails around
and fights back during restraints, but he eventually calms down.
Youth E was interviewed face to face at the facility on 8/17/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth E reported he was in
his room on 8/10/23 when he heard metal clanging, so he came
out of his room. He reported he went to the milieu and saw Youth
A holding a metal pole he got off one of the chairs. Youth E
reported Staff 5 and Staff 7 restrained Youth A and Youth A was
fighting against them. Youth E reported Youth A was screaming
and calling the staff “Niggers”, which made Youth E angry. Youth
E reported Youth A was also yelling at the staff to let him go.
Youth E reported Staff 6 and Supervisor were guarding the doors
by the bedroom hallways so none of the other youth could come
5

into the milieu. Youth E reported he went back to his room. Shortly
after, Youth E heard Youth A screaming, so Youth E came out of
his room again and entered the milieu. Supervisor asked Youth E
to move a table out of the way because Youth A was close to it,
and she didn’t want Youth A to hurt himself, so Youth E followed
directions and moved the table. Youth E reported Youth A bit Staff
5’s leg, which resulted in all staff letting go of Youth A and backing
away. Youth E reported Staff 11 told Youth A “you can’t keep
acting like this” and Youth A yelled back at Staff 11. Youth E
reported he went back to his room, but he heard Youth F go out to
the milieu, so he went back out to the milieu again. Youth E
reported Staff 7 was trying to block Youth F from fighting with
Youth A. Youth E reported Youth A got in Youth F’s face while
Staff 7 was in between them. Youth E reported Youth F got
around Staff 7, began hitting Youth A and Youth A was hitting
Youth F. Youth E reported Staff 6, Staff 7 and Staff 11 were trying
to separate Youth A and Youth F. Youth E reported Youth B then
came into the milieu and hit Youth A three times before Staff 7 put
his hands on Youth B’s shoulders and escorted him away from the
situation. Youth E reported Staff 6, Staff 7 and Staff 11 were
continuously telling Youth F to stop and trying to deescalate the
situation. Youth E reported the staff were also consistently trying
to get Youth F away from Youth A, but they couldn’t restrain Youth
F because both Youth F and Youth A were moving around too
much. Youth E stated Youth F finally stopped hitting Youth A and
a staff member (couldn’t remember who) guided Youth F away
from the situation. Youth E reported all the youth went back to
their rooms for the remainder of the night. Youth E reported he
had no concerns with how staff handled the situation as they were
actively trying to protect the staff and all the youth, including Youth
A. Youth E reported he has seen at least five other restraints
conducted on Youth A and he has had no concerns with how staff
handled them. Youth E reported he has never seen staff do
anything violent to Youth A (hit, kick, bang his head, choke, smash
him against the wall or floor, threaten him, etc.). Youth E reported
he has never heard Youth A complain about injuries from a
restraint.
Youth F was interviewed face to face at the facility on 8/22/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth F reported he was in
his room on 8/10/23 and kept hearing furniture being moved and
Youth A yelling. Youth F reported he became aggravated because
it was bedtime, and he was trying to sleep. Youth F reported he
went into the milieu and saw Staff 5 and two other staff (couldn’t
remember who) restraining Youth A in a seated position. Youth F
stated Staff 5 wasn’t holding Youth A tight or being aggressive
6

with him. Youth F reported Staff 6, Staff 7, Staff 11, and
Supervisor were all in the milieu area as well. Youth F reported
Youth A yelled “you only restrained me because I’m white” and
then began calling staff members “Niggers”, which made Youth F
angry. Youth F reported staff told him to go back to his room, so
he did. Youth F reported he continued to hear yelling coming from
the milieu, so he came back out of his room. Youth F stated Youth
A kept calling staff “Niggers” and cussing at them. Youth F
reported staff were trying to calm Youth A down, but he wouldn’t
stop. Youth F reported Youth A started to mouth off by cussing at
him and then tried to punch him. Youth F reported he began
fighting with Youth A. Youth F reported staff (not sure who) were
trying to pull him off Youth A, but they weren’t successful because
Youth F was too strong. Youth F reported Staff 11 finally got him
off Youth A by getting behind him, putting his hands on his waist,
escorting him away from the situation and asking him to go back
to his room. Youth F reported he listened to Staff 11 and remained
in his room the rest of the night. Youth F reported he has seen
approximately 3-4 additional restraints completed for Youth A and
staff handled everything appropriately. Youth F reported Youth A
is constantly flailing and fighting back during restraints. Youth F
reported he has never seen staff do anything violent to Youth A
(hit, kick, bang his head, choke, smash him against the wall or
floor, threaten him, etc.). Youth F reported he has never heard
Youth A complain about injuries from a restraint.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
8/16/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor
reported she came into work on her day off on 8/10/23 because
Staff 7 called and reported they needed support as Youth A was
back and was pounding on the doors and windows. Supervisor
came in and Youth A immediately began cussing her out and
yelling at her for him being back at the facility. Supervisor reported
she told Youth A she did not make the decision as to whether he
came back to the facility and he would need to talk to FCW.
Supervisor reported Youth A hit the window and yelled “they lied
to me”. Supervisor reported she tried to shift the conversation by
asking him about how he got caught from being AWOL. Youth A
began talking to her and he was beginning to escalate and joke
with her during the conversation. Supervisor reported she asked
Youth A if he took his medications at the hospital, and he reported
hospital staff told him he couldn’t take his medications tonight
because they didn’t know what substances or medications he had
consumed earlier in the day. Supervisor reported all the youth
began coming back onto the unit and Supervisor instructed all the
youth to go to their rooms because Youth A was beginning to
7

escalate again. Supervisor reported Youth A asked to go to his
room, so Staff 6 let him in. Supervisor reported Youth A was in his
room for a minute when Staff 6 saw Youth A coming out of his
room with a metal pole in his hand. Supervisor reported when
Youth A entered the milieu, he began hitting the windows, tables,
doors and key fob pad with the pole. Supervisor encouraged
Youth A to put the pole down, but he didn’t listen, so Supervisor
reported she, Staff 5 and Staff 11 surrounded him to try and get
the metal pole from him. Supervisor reported Youth A put his arm
at his side while he was holding the pole, so she tried to grab it
from him, but he hit her on the side of her face with the pole.
Supervisor reported Staff 5 initiated a one-person restraint on
Youth A and Staff 11 was able to get the pole away from Youth A.
Youth A punched Staff 11 in the face. Supervisor reported Youth
A was fighting hard by kicking and hitting. When Youth A dropped
his weight, Staff 5 transitioned to a one-person seated restraint
and Staff 2 and Staff 7 assisted by securing Youth A’s arms.
Supervisor reported Youth A proceeded to bite Staff 5 on the leg,
so all three staff disengaged the restraint. Supervisor reported
since Youth A was still on the floor and stopped kicking, hitting,
and fighting, she told the rest of the staff there was no need to
reengage a restraint. Supervisor reported she, Staff 2, Staff 6 and
Staff 7 were with Youth A when other youth started coming out of
their rooms because they heard yelling. Supervisor reported when
the other youth entered the milieu, Youth A began yelling at them
saying “I’ll beat your ass. Come on niggers. I wanna fuck you up
niggers”. Supervisor told the other staff to get the youth back into
their rooms because Youth A was escalating again. Supervisor
reported Youth A was yelling back and forth with Youth B, Youth E
and Youth F. Supervisor told the three youth to go back to their
rooms, but they didn’t listen. Supervisor reported she was in
between Youth A and Youth E, Staff 6 was in between Youth A
and Youth B and she couldn’t remember which staff member was
in between Youth A and Youth F to prevent any altercations.
Supervisor reported Youth A got off the floor and tried to punch
Youth F, but Youth F dodged and punched Youth A instead.
Supervisor reported while the two youth were fighting, Youth A fell
to the floor and somehow Youth B got around Staff 6 and began
hitting and kicking Youth A too. Supervisor reported Staff 2, Staff 6
and Staff 11 were actively trying to get in between the Youth A,
Youth B and Youth F to separate them, but it didn’t work, and the
staff members ended up getting hit in the process. Supervisor
reported she was able to open her office door and told Youth A to
get into her office. After Youth A was in Supervisor’s office, all the
other youth were able to be escorted back to their rooms.
Supervisor checked on Youth A. Youth A had scratches on the
8

back of his neck, a swollen eye, swollen face and said his hands
hurt from punching others. Supervisor reported Youth A was
crying and repeating “I don’t want to be here. I said I didn’t want to
come back here”. Supervisor reported she offered him ice, but he
refused. Supervisor reported the on-call nurse came to do an
assessment, but ultimately Youth A was taken to the hospital.
Supervisor reported all staff present during the incident on 8/10/23
acted appropriately, professionally and with everyone’s safety as a
top priority. Supervisor reported the restraint was performed
appropriately and Youth A never complained about staff causing
any injuries. Supervisor reported she has witnessed or been a part
of at least two other restraints regarding Youth A. Supervisor
reported during the restraint on 7/20/23, Youth A complained Staff
7 was trying to “kill him” during the restraint, but Youth A clarified
afterwards it was because he felt Staff 7 was so much bigger than
him and wasn’t trying to hurt him. Supervisor reported Youth A’s
worker came for a visit on 7/21/23 and she discussed Youth A’s
allegations of staff causing injuries to him during restraints.
Supervisor reported she demonstrated the different restraints and
comparing them to the bruises Youth A had at the time.
Supervisor reported during restraints Youth A spits, hits, bites,
kicks, and fights against staff, so bruises are likely to happen
because of his actions during the restraint being performed.
Supervisor reported she conducts bruise and injury checks as well
as debriefs after restraints to ensure the youth are okay.
Supervisor reported she makes sure she always has another staff
member present during the bruise/injury checks as well as the
restraint debriefs, and other than the complaint to FCW about
bruises, Youth A has never alleged any staff members have
threatened him, choked him, sat on him, banged his head on a
wall, kicked him, hit him, etc.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 8/16/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported he has
never called Youth A a “rich little white boy” or said he “hoped
Youth A’s grandma would die”. Staff 1 reported he has never
heard any staff verbally threaten or insult Youth A. Staff 1 reported
he has never seen any staff be aggressive with, injure or
improperly physically restrain Youth A. Staff 1 reported he was
present for a restraint in May 2023, which was a two-person Aegis
hold, but he cannot remember the other staff member involved.
He reported the restraint went well and Youth A never complained
he was being hurt during or after the restraint.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 8/16/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported when
9

Youth A arrived at the facility on 8/10/23, he paced around the
milieu for a bit and then requested to make a phone call. After the
phone call, Youth A seemed more escalated. Staff 2 reported
Youth A began pacing again and demanded staff call the police so
he could get out of the facility. He asked to go into his room, and
he was allowed to. He came out of his room after a minute, and he
had a metal pole in his hand. Staff 2 reported Youth A was holding
the metal pole, pacing around the unit and began trying to hit walls
and windows with the pole. Staff 2 reported he went to the staff
office and called the on-call nurse to be proactive because if it
escalated more, he assumed they might have to restrain Youth A.
As he was on the phone with the on-call nurse, Staff 2 reported he
looked out the window and Youth A was swinging the metal pole
at Supervisor. Staff 2 reported Staff 5, Staff 6, Staff 7, and Staff 11
were also in the milieu. Staff 2 reported as Staff 5 was trying to
restrain Youth A, Youth A punched Staff 11 in the face. Staff 5
was able to restrain Youth A while Staff 2 and Staff 7 assisted with
Youth A’s arms. Staff 2 reported while Youth A was in the
restraint, Youth A bit Staff 5’s leg, which caused Staff 5, Staff 2,
and Staff 7 to release the restraint. Other youth began to come out
of their rooms, so Staff 2, Staff 6, Staff 7, Staff 11, and Supervisor
were encouraging them to go back to their rooms. Youth A began
to call the staff and youth “Niggers” and was provoking the other
youth to beat him up. Staff 2 reported he and Staff 7 were trying to
step in between Youth A and the rest of the youth to prevent an
altercation, but Youth A began physically fighting with Youth B and
Youth F. Staff 2 reported Youth B backed up from the fight on his
own while Staff 2 and Staff 7 separated Youth A and Youth F.
After the youth stopped fighting, all the youth went back to their
rooms. Staff 2 reported there were no concerns with the restraint
performed and Youth A never complained about being injured.
Staff 2 reported he was involved in one other restraint for Youth A
in July 2023 and there were no concerns with that restraint either.
Staff 2 reported Youth A never complained about the restraint or
being injured during the restraint. Staff 2 reported he checked in
with Youth A after the July 2023 restraint to debrief with him and
Youth A never complained about any injuries or how the restraint
was performed. Staff 2 reported no staff have ever threatened,
choked, banged Youth A’s head on a wall, hit, kicked, or sat on
Youth A.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 8/16/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported she
participated in a restraint for Youth A on 7/20/23. Staff 3 reported
Youth A was fighting by scratching, biting, and hitting staff. Staff 3
reported Youth A did not complain about any injuries. Staff 3
10

reported she was close with Youth A, and he never complained to
her about any concerns he had with staff at the facility threatening
or hurting him. Staff 3 reported Youth A would say he didn’t want
to be at the facility and just wanted to be free.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 8/16/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 reported she
participated in a restraint for Youth A on 7/15/23. She reported the
restraint was a two-person standing restraint and she conducted it
with Staff 6. Staff 4 reported Youth A did not complain of any
injuries. Staff 4 reported she worked on 7/20/23 but did not
observe the restraint or complete the debrief meeting with Youth
A. Staff 4 reported she has never seen any staff members verbally
threaten or physically injure Youth A. Staff 4 reported she has
never heard Youth A complain about staff hurting him but has
complained about not wanting to be at the facility.
Staff 5 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 8/17/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Staff 5 reported when
Youth A came back to the unit on 8/10/23 and asked to go to his
room, so he was allowed to. Youth A exited his room a minute
later with a metal pole in his hand. Staff 5 reported Youth A
walked around the unit tapping the metal pole on the walls,
objects, and windows. Staff 5 heard Supervisor say they needed
to get the pole, so Youth A didn’t hurt anyone. Staff 5 reported
Youth A put the metal pole to his side and Supervisor tried to grab
it, but Youth A hit her in the face with the pole. Staff 5 said Staff 11
grabbed the pole and slid it across the floor. Staff 5 then put Youth
A in a one person standing restraint, which immediately turned
into a one person seated restraint because Youth A was fighting
so much and dropped his weight. Staff 5 reported Staff 2 and Staff
7 secured Youth A’s arms. While in the restraint, Youth A leaned
down and bit Staff 5’s leg, which caused Staff 5 to release the
restraint. Staff 5 reported he walked away and went to the staff
office. He looked out of the staff office window and saw Youth A
fighting with Youth B and Youth F. Staff 5 reported Supervisor,
Staff 2, Staff 7 and Staff 11 were actively trying to separate the
three youth and also instructing the other youth in the milieu to go
back to their rooms. Staff 5 reported he remained in the staff office
because his leg was in a lot of pain. Staff 5 reported Youth A
complained about his arm hurting during the restraint, but Staff 5
reported Youth A’s arm likely hurt because he was resisting and
fighting so much. Staff 5 reported they performed the restraint
correctly and there were no concerns about any of the staff’s
behavior towards Youth A. Staff 5 reported no one threatened
11

Youth A during the restraint. Staff 5 reported he has never seen
any other restraints performed on Youth A.
Staff 6 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 8/22/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Staff 6 reported on 8/10/23
Youth A didn’t want to go to bed so he stayed in the milieu pacing,
putting his head against the wall and covering his head with his
hands. Staff 6 reported she, Supervisor, Staff 2, Staff 5, Staff 7
and Staff 11 were all in the milieu and staff office area observing
Youth A. Youth A asked to go to his room, so Staff 6 let him into
his room. A minute later, Youth A came out with a metal pole in
his hand. He was pacing with it in his hand, yelling he didn’t want
to be at the facility. Staff 6 reported he hit the windows in the unit
as well as the kitchen door. Supervisor tried to get the metal pole
out of Youth A’s hand, but he pulled it away from her and hit
Supervisor in the face. Staff 5 put Youth A in a one-person
standing restraint and Supervisor was able to get the pole away
from him. Staff 11 was attempting to help with the restraint, but
Youth A punched him in the face, so he backed off. Staff 6
reported Staff 5 had to transition to a one-person seated restraint
because of Youth A’s resistance. After they were seated, Staff 2
and Staff 7 assisted with the restraint by securing Youth A’s arms.
